attributes.action: Suspend lifting of energy price cap, whilst companies report record profits.
attributes.additional_details:
Ofgem are a government department, responsible for the lifting of (or not) energy prices caps and the regulation of the energy industry. 
Whilst the nation struggles with day to day costs, inflation rising, and stagnant wages, energy firms report record breaking profits, whilst we suffer. 
We demand the government put a freeze on raising the price cap further, before millions of families fall into fuel poverty, debt and ill health, all for the sake of lining shareholders pockets.

rejection.details:
The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a "Triple lock" to restrict energy cap increases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621347

Reform energy pricing and taxes to better protect lower income households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621407

Subsidise a 'basic' amount of electricity for households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915
